meta.title: Hebrew Names Lexicon
meta.description: Restored Hebrew divine names and titles with Hebrew text, transliterations, and meanings

names.label: Yahuah Elohiym
names.meaning: Lord God / Lord the Mighty One
names.context: The covenant name joined with the title of divine power, often used in creation and covenant passages

names.label: Adonai Yahuah
names.context: A reverent title combining Adonai (“Master, Lord”) with the divine name, often translated “Lord GOD

names.label: El Shaddai
names.context: Ancient divine title emphasizing God's power and sufficiency. Reveals God’s nurturing yet powerful nature—the One who provides, protects, and sustains

names.label: El Elyon
names.context: Divine title emphasizing God's supremacy above all heavenly beings and powers

names.label: Ruach Ha'Qodesh
names.context: The holy, consecrating Spirit of God that empowers, convicts, and guides

names.label: Ruach Elohiym
names.context: The Spirit of God, emphasizing divine origin. The divine breath or Spirit moving in creation and revelation; the power and presence of God in motion

names.label: Yahusha Ha'Mashiach
names.meaning: God is Salvation, the Anointed One / Jesus Christ
names.context: The Messiah, the anointed one, Savior. Derived from Yah (Yahuah) + Yasha (“to save”). Reveals that salvation comes from the Lord Himself

names.label: Mashiach
names.context: The anointed one, the promised deliverer. The one chosen, consecrated, and empowered by Yahuah for redemption and kingship—fulfilled in Yahusha

names.label: Yah
names.context: The shortened form of the divine name, used in praise and poetry. Seen in “HalleluYah” (Praise God). Expresses the eternal existence of the Most High

names.label: Yahuah
names.meaning: 'Lord', 'The Eternal, Self-Existent One (“He Who Is, Was, and Will Be”)'
names.context: The personal name of God revealed to Moses in Exodus 3:14–15. Derived from hayah (“to exist”). Represents the eternal covenant name of the Most High

names.label: Elohiym
names.context: A plural form used for majesty, describing the divine power and authority of God
